# 1 Minute Academy
# This file helps LLM tools discover high-level entry points.

Site: http://localhost:5173
Sitemap: http://localhost:5173/sitemap.xml

Primary pages:
- http://localhost:5173/
- http://localhost:5173/topics
- http://localhost:5173/pricing
- http://localhost:5173/faq

Topics (published):
- Agent vs Automation: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--agent-builder-lab--t01-agent-vs-automation — A quick, practical guide to Agent vs Automation.
- The Observe → Think → Act Loop: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--agent-builder-lab--t02-the-observe-think-act-loop — A quick win: understand The Observe → Think → Act Loop.

- Citation Hallucinations: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t19-citation-hallucinations — When AI invents fake references that look completely real.
- Confident Wrong Answers: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t20-confident-wrong-answers — Why AI is most dangerous when it's confidently incorrect.
- Detecting Hallucinations: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t21-detecting-hallucinations — Practical techniques for catching AI fabrications before users see them.
- Multi-Step Math Failures: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t22-multi-step-math — Why LLMs struggle with calculations that require multiple steps.
- Logic Puzzle Failures: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t23-logic-puzzle-failures — When seemingly simple logical reasoning stumps advanced models.
- Spatial Reasoning: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t24-spatial-reasoning — Why LLMs can't reliably think about physical space and positions.
- Knowledge Cutoff: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t25-knowledge-cutoff — Why models don't know about events after their training date.
- Lost in the Middle: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t26-lost-in-the-middle — Models pay more attention to the beginning and end of long contexts.
- Token Limits in Practice: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t27-token-limits-in-practice — What actually happens when you exceed or approach context limits.
- Sycophancy: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t28-sycophancy — Why models agree with you even when you're wrong.
- Positional Bias: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t29-positional-bias — Models favor options based on their position, not their quality.
- Format Sensitivity: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t30-format-sensitivity — How prompt formatting dramatically affects model performance.
- Structured Output Tricks: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t31-structured-output-tricks — Forcing reliable JSON, XML, and structured data from unreliable models.
- Ensemble Approaches: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--model-limitations--t32-ensemble-approaches — Using multiple models or calls to compensate for individual model weaknesses.
- What Is Prompt Engineering?: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t01-what-is-prompt-engineering — Why the words you feed an LLM matter more than you think.
- Anatomy of a Prompt: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t02-anatomy-of-a-prompt — The four parts every effective prompt contains.
- Role Prompting: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t03-role-prompting — Give the model an identity and watch the output change.
- Be Specific: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t04-be-specific — Vague prompts get vague answers. Precision pays off.
- Zero-Shot Prompting: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t05-zero-shot-prompting — Getting answers without providing any examples.
- System Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t06-system-prompts — The hidden instructions that set the model's behavior.
- Few-Shot Examples: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t07-few-shot-examples — Show the model what you want by giving it examples.
- Delimiters & Structure: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t08-delimiters-and-structure — Use markers to separate instructions from content.
- Step-by-Step Instructions: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t09-step-by-step-instructions — Break complex tasks into numbered steps for better results.
- Prompt Templates: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t10-prompt-templates — Build reusable prompt scaffolds with fill-in-the-blank slots.
- Chain of Thought: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t11-chain-of-thought — Make the model show its reasoning to get better answers.
- Self-Consistency: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t12-self-consistency — Run the same prompt multiple times and pick the majority answer.
- Tree of Thought: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t13-tree-of-thought — Explore branching reasoning paths for complex problems.
- ReAct Framework: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t14-react-framework — Combine reasoning with real actions in a single loop.
- Meta-Prompting: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t15-meta-prompting — Use the model to write and improve its own prompts.
- Controlling Output Format: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t16-controlling-output-format — Make the model return exactly the structure you need.
- Temperature & Sampling: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t17-temperature-and-sampling — Control randomness to get creative or deterministic results.
- Token Limits & Context Windows: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t18-token-limits-and-context-windows — Understand the hard ceiling on what the model can see.
- Max Tokens & Stop Sequences: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t19-max-tokens-and-stop-sequences — Tell the model when to stop talking.
- Guardrails in Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t20-guardrails-in-prompts — Prevent the model from going off-script.
- Summarization Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t21-summarization-prompts — Get concise, accurate summaries from long text.
- Classification Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t22-classification-prompts — Sort text into categories reliably.
- Extraction Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t23-extraction-prompts — Pull structured data from unstructured text.
- Code Generation Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t24-code-generation-prompts — Get the model to write code that actually runs.
- Multi-Turn Conversations: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t25-multi-turn-conversations — Design prompts that work across multiple back-and-forth exchanges.
- Common Prompt Failures: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t26-common-prompt-failures — Recognize the patterns behind prompts that don't work.
- Iterating on Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t27-iterating-on-prompts — The systematic way to improve prompts through testing.
- Eval Sets for Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t28-eval-sets-for-prompts — Build a test suite that catches regressions in your prompts.
- A/B Testing Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t29-a-b-testing-prompts — Compare prompt variants with real user traffic.
- Version Control for Prompts: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t30-version-control-for-prompts — Track every prompt change like you track code changes.
- Prompt Caching: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t31-prompt-caching — Save money and latency by caching repeated prompt results.
- Cost Optimization: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t32-cost-optimization — Spend less on API calls without sacrificing quality.
- Monitoring Prompt Quality: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t33-monitoring-prompt-quality — Catch prompt degradation before users notice.
- Prompt Security: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--prompt-engineering--t34-prompt-security — Defend against injection, extraction, and manipulation.
- What Is RAG?: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t01-what-is-rag — The pattern that grounds LLMs in your actual data.
- RAG vs Fine-Tuning: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t02-rag-vs-fine-tuning — When to retrieve and when to retrain.
- The RAG Pipeline: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t03-the-rag-pipeline — End-to-end flow from user question to grounded answer.
- When RAG Fails: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t04-when-rag-fails — Common RAG failure modes and how to spot them.
- What Are Embeddings?: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t05-what-are-embeddings — Turning text into numbers that capture meaning.
- Embedding Models: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t06-embedding-models — Which embedding model to use and why it matters.
- Vector Databases: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t07-vector-databases — Where embeddings live and how you search them fast.
- Similarity Metrics: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t08-similarity-metrics — Cosine similarity, dot product, and how to measure closeness.
- Why Chunking Matters: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t09-why-chunking-matters — Breaking documents into retrieval-friendly pieces.
- Chunking Strategies: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t10-chunking-strategies — Fixed-size, semantic, and recursive approaches compared.
- Overlapping Chunks: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t11-overlapping-chunks — Use overlap to preserve context across chunk boundaries.
- Metadata Enrichment: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t12-metadata-enrichment — Attach metadata to chunks to improve filtering and retrieval.
- Semantic Search: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t13-semantic-search — Finding documents by meaning, not just keywords.
- Hybrid Search: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t14-hybrid-search — Combine keyword and semantic search for the best of both.
- Reranking: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t15-reranking — Use a second model to refine the order of retrieved results.
- Query Transformation: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t16-query-transformation — Rewrite the user's question to improve retrieval.
- Grounded Generation: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t17-grounded-generation — Making the model answer from retrieved context, not from memory.
- Citing Sources: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t18-citing-sources — Make the model point to where it found the answer.
- Context Window Management: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t19-context-window-management — Fit the right amount of context without overflowing the window.
- Answer Synthesis: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t20-answer-synthesis — Combining information from multiple chunks into one coherent answer.
- Measuring Retrieval Quality: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t21-measuring-retrieval-quality — Metrics that tell you if your retrieval pipeline works.
- Measuring Answer Quality: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t22-measuring-answer-quality — Evaluate the final generated answer, not just the retrieval.
- Keeping the Index Fresh: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t23-keeping-the-index-fresh — Update your knowledge base without rebuilding everything.
- RAG in Production: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t24-rag-in-production — Operational considerations for production RAG systems.
- Document Loaders: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t25-document-loaders — How to ingest diverse document types into your RAG pipeline.
- Embedding Dimensions: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t26-embedding-dimensions — How the number of dimensions affects quality, speed, and cost.
- Recursive Chunking: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t27-recursive-chunking — A chunking strategy that respects document structure by splitting at natural boundaries.
- Parent Document Retrieval: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t28-parent-document-retrieval — Retrieve small chunks for precision, then expand to parent documents for context.
- Multi-Query Retrieval: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t29-multi-query-retrieval — Generate multiple query variations to improve retrieval recall.
- Prompt Engineering for RAG: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t30-prompt-engineering-for-rag — Craft generation prompts that keep the LLM faithful to retrieved context.
- Handling No Results: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t31-handling-no-results — What your RAG system should do when retrieval comes up empty.
- Chunking Tables & Code: http://localhost:5173/topic/ai--rag-basics--t32-chunking-for-tables-and-code — Special chunking strategies for structured content like tables and code blocks.
- What Are the Elements of Art?: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t01-what-are-the-elements-of-art — The seven building blocks every visual work is made from.
- Line: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t02-line — The most fundamental mark — and what it can express.
- Shape: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t03-shape — Two-dimensional areas defined by edges — geometric and organic.
- Form: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t04-form — When shapes gain a third dimension and become solid objects.
- Color Basics: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t05-color-basics — Hue, saturation, and value — the three properties of every color.
- Space: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t06-space — Creating the illusion of depth and distance on a flat surface.
- Texture: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t07-texture — How a surface feels — or how you make it look like it feels.
- Balance: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t08-balance — Visual weight and how to distribute it across a composition.
- Contrast: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t09-contrast — Differences that create visual interest and direct the eye.
- Emphasis: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t10-emphasis — Making the most important part of your artwork impossible to miss.
- Movement & Rhythm: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t11-movement-and-rhythm — Guiding the viewer's eye through a composition with visual flow.
- Unity & Variety: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t12-unity-and-variety — The push-pull between cohesion and visual interest.
- The Value Scale: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t13-the-value-scale — Understanding the range from pure white to pure black.
- Light & Shadow: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t14-light-and-shadow — How light reveals form through a predictable pattern of values.
- Value Studies: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t15-value-studies — Quick grayscale sketches that plan the light structure of your artwork.
- Cast Shadows: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t16-cast-shadows — The shadows objects throw onto other surfaces — and what they reveal.
- Edge Quality: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t17-edge-quality — Hard, soft, and lost edges — the secret weapon of atmosphere.
- One-Point Perspective: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t18-one-point-perspective — All lines converge to a single vanishing point on the horizon.
- Two-Point Perspective: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t19-two-point-perspective — Two vanishing points create more dynamic, angled views.
- Overlapping & Size: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t20-overlapping-and-size — The simplest depth cues — and the first ones children learn.
- Atmospheric Perspective: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t21-atmospheric-perspective — How air itself creates depth by softening distant objects.
- Foreground, Middle & Background: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t22-foreground-middle-background — Layering depth into three zones for clear spatial organization.
- Actual vs Visual Texture: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t23-actual-vs-visual-texture — The difference between real surface feel and the illusion of it.
- Mark-Making: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t24-mark-making — The vocabulary of strokes and marks that create visual texture.
- Surface & Substrate: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t25-surface-and-substrate — How paper, canvas, wood, and digital screens affect your artwork.
- Pattern & Repetition: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t26-pattern-and-repetition — Repeating elements to create visual rhythm and decorative richness.
- Thumbnail Sketches: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t27-thumbnail-sketches — Tiny, fast sketches that explore compositions before you commit.
- The Rule of Thirds: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t28-the-rule-of-thirds — A simple grid that creates naturally pleasing compositions.
- Limited Palette: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t29-limited-palette — Why using fewer colors creates more harmonious artwork.
- Critiquing Your Own Work: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t30-critiquing-your-own-work — Techniques for objectively evaluating your artwork.
- Scale & Proportion: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t31-scale-and-proportion — How size relationships create meaning, drama, and realism.
- Visual Weight: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t32-visual-weight — What makes some elements feel heavier than others in a composition.
- Building a Visual Library: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t33-building-a-visual-library — How studying references and practicing daily builds artistic memory.
- Art as Communication: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-foundations--t34-art-as-communication — Every artwork is a message — the elements and principles are your language.
- Cave Paintings: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t01-cave-paintings — Humanity's oldest artworks and the birth of visual expression.
- Egyptian Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t02-egyptian-art — Art designed for eternity — the visual language of ancient Egypt.
- Greek Classical Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t03-greek-classical-art — The pursuit of ideal beauty and perfect human proportions.
- Roman Art & Engineering: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t04-roman-art — Practical art: portraits, propaganda, and architectural marvels.
- Medieval Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t05-medieval-art — Art in service of faith — symbols, gold, and spiritual meaning.
- The Renaissance: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t06-renaissance-rebirth — The rebirth of classical ideals — perspective, anatomy, and humanism.
- Baroque Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t07-baroque-art — Drama, emotion, movement — art that overwhelms the senses.
- Dutch Golden Age: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t08-dutch-golden-age — Art for the people — landscapes, still lifes, and everyday scenes.
- Romanticism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t09-romanticism — Emotion, nature, and the sublime — art rebels against reason.
- Impressionism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t10-impressionism — Capturing light and the fleeting moment — painting outdoors changes everything.
- Post-Impressionism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t11-post-impressionism — Going beyond light — structure, emotion, and personal expression.
- Cubism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t12-cubism — Shattering perspective — showing multiple viewpoints simultaneously.
- Expressionism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t13-expressionism — Distorting reality to express inner emotional experience.
- Surrealism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t14-surrealism — Unlocking the unconscious mind through dreamlike imagery.
- Abstract Expressionism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t15-abstract-expressionism — Pure emotion on canvas — the New York School and the gesture.
- Pop Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t16-pop-art — Mass culture becomes high art — soup cans, celebrities, and comic strips.
- Minimalism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t17-minimalism — Stripped to essentials — geometry, industrial materials, and presence.

- Digital & AI Art: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--art-history-essentials--t20-digital-and-ai-art — New tools, old questions — technology reshapes artistic creation.

- What Is Color?: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t01-what-is-color — How light creates the perception of color in our eyes and brains.
- The Color Wheel: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t02-the-color-wheel — The foundational tool that organizes colors by their relationships.
- Hue: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t03-hue — The pure color family — the name we give a wavelength of light.
- Saturation: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t04-saturation — The intensity or purity of a color — from vivid to muted.
- Value in Color: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t05-value-in-color — How light or dark a color is — the most important property.
- Complementary Colors: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t06-complementary-colors — Opposite colors on the wheel — maximum contrast and vibration.
- Analogous Colors: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t07-analogous-colors — Neighboring colors on the wheel — natural harmony and unity.
- Triadic Colors: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t08-triadic-colors — Three colors equally spaced on the wheel — vibrant and balanced.
- Split Complementary: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t09-split-complementary — A safer version of complementary — one base plus two neighbors of its opposite.
- Warm & Cool Colors: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t10-warm-and-cool-colors — How temperature divides the wheel and affects mood and depth.
- Color & Emotion: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t11-color-and-emotion — How different colors trigger psychological and emotional responses.
- Color Symbolism: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t12-color-symbolism — The cultural meanings embedded in colors across traditions.
- Color & Branding: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t13-color-and-branding — How businesses use color psychology to shape perception.
- Color & Appetite: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t14-color-and-appetite — Why red makes you hungry and blue suppresses appetite.
- Mixing Colors: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t15-mixing-colors — The practical skill of creating any color from a limited palette.
- Color Harmony: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t16-color-harmony — Why some color combinations feel pleasing and others feel jarring.
- Color Temperature in Light & Shadow: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t17-color-temperature-in-light-and-shadow — Why warm light creates cool shadows and vice versa.
- Local vs Observed Color: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t18-local-color-vs-observed-color — The color you think something is vs the color you actually see.
- Simultaneous Contrast: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t19-simultaneous-contrast — How surrounding colors change how a color appears.
- RGB Color Model: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t20-rgb-color-model — How screens create color by adding red, green, and blue light.
- CMYK Color Model: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t21-cmyk-color-model — The subtractive model used for printing — cyan, magenta, yellow, and key (black).
- Hex Codes: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t22-hex-codes — The six-digit code that precisely identifies any digital color.
- Color Gamut: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t23-color-gamut — The range of colors a device or medium can reproduce.
- Color Accessibility: http://localhost:5173/topic/art--color-theory--t24-color-accessibility — Designing with color so everyone — including colorblind users — can access your work.
- …and 246 more (see sitemap).
